page.title: 12Local large scale industry
page.content: By far the larges industrial concern close to the school is the BP Saltend chemical works. It employs a significant proportion of Preston's working population. The Saltend site was begun after the First World War and by the 1930's it was owned and run by the Distillers Company limited. The products included spirit used in the manufacture of alcoholic drinks and acetic acid. During the 1960's BP bought the plant and began a significant expansion programme making BP Saltend the largest acetic acid making plant in Europe. The Saltend site was originally built for Green and Co.
